skills.name: Write a recurring decimal with a single digit recurring pattern as a fraction
Write a recurring decimal with a double digit recurring pattern as a fraction

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember the dot means the number will be repeated forever
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember the dot means the number will be repeated forever
explanations.C: The dot above the p means that it is repeated forever. So it is 0.pppppppppppp.....
explanations.D: Not quite. Remember the dot means the number will be repeated forever

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember the dot means the number will be repeated forever
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember the dot means the number will be repeated forever
explanations.C: Almost. The dot is only above the z, so that is the only digit that is repeated
explanations.D: The dot is only above the z, so only z is repeated.

explanations.B: Not quite, this is only true when p = 3. Try putting in some different values for p and change the decimal into a fraction
explanations.C: Not quite, if p = 3 you would have 0.33333333 = 3/3 = 1 which isn't true. Try putting in some different values for p and changing the decimal into a fraction
explanations.D: Let x = 0.pppppppp, then 10x = p.ppppppp. If we do 10x - x we have 9x = p, so x = p/9.

explanations.A: Not quite. Try putting in some different values for z and changing the decimal into a fraction
explanations.B: Not quite, I think you are trying to simplify the fraction. 0.099999... would simplify to 3/30, but the z isn't the same in both representation.  Try putting in some different values for z and change the decimal into a fraction
explanations.C: Let x = 0.0zzzzzzz, so 10x = 0.zzzzzzzzzz and 100x = z.zzzzzzzz. When we do 100x - 10x we get 90x = z, so x = z/90
explanations.D: Not quite, I think you forgot to take into account the dot above the z. Try putting in some different values for z and change the decimal into a fraction

explanations.A: The dot is only above the q, so only that is repeated giving 0.pqqqqqqqqqq
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember the dot is above the number that will be repeated
explanations.C: Not quite, there is no dot above the p so that is not repeated
explanations.D: Not quite. Remember the dot is above the number that will be repeated

explanations.A: Not quite. There are dots above the y and z so both of these are repeated
explanations.B: Not quite. There are dots above the y and z so both of these are repeated
explanations.C: There is a dot above the y and z so both of these are repeated giving 0.yzyzyzyzyz
explanations.D: Not quite. There are dots above the y and z so both of these are repeated

explanations.A: Make x = 0.pqqqqqq. 100x = pq.qqqqq and 10x = p.qqqqqqqq. 100x - 10x = 90x which is pq - p. Divide this by 90 to get x = pq - p / 90
explanations.B: Not quite, this would be true if p and q were both repeated, notice the dot is only above the q. Try multiplying by 100 and 10
explanations.C: Not quite. Try multiplying by 100 and 10
explanations.D: Not quite. Try multiplying by 100 and 10

explanations.A: Not quite. Try multiplying by 100 and 10
explanations.B: Make x = 0.yzzzzzzz. 100x = yz.zzzzzzzz and 10x = y.zzzzzzzz 100x - 10x = 90x which is yz - y. Divide this by 90 to get x = yz - y / 90
explanations.C: Not quite. Try multiplying by 100 and 10
explanations.D: Not quite. Try multiplying by 100 and 10

explanations.B: Let x = 0.pqpqpqpq, then 100x = pq.pqpqpqp... Doing 100x - x we get 99x = pq, so x = pq/99

explanations.D: Let x = 0.yzyzyzyz, then 100x = yz.yzyzyzyz... Doing 100x - x we get 99x = yz, so x = yz/99
